summary.title: University Student Portal
summary.description: University portal for students and faculty to manage courses, grades, and assignments

threats.title: Expedition
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #6:
Using speed to violate explicit or implicit assumptions about the application’s normal use to achieve unfair individual gain
threats.mitigation: Defences include providing enforcement of behavioral workflow and anti-automation

threats.title: Vulnerability scanning
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #14:
Systematic enumeration and examination in order to find weaknesses and points where a security vulnerability might exist
threats.mitigation: Defence includes providing anti-automation

threats.title: Denial of Service
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #15:
Usage may resemble legitimate application usage but leads to exhaustion of resources
threats.mitigation: Mitigation or prevention such as providing backoff, resource management and avoiding forced deadlock

threats.title: Authentication service overload
threats.description: Attackers could flood the authentication service with requests, making it unavailable for legitimate students"
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, CAPTCHA, and request throttling

threats.title: Credential manipulation
threats.description: Attackers could modify authentication requests
threats.mitigation: Request signing and integrity checks

threats.title: Authentication data exposure
threats.description: Credentials or session tokens could be exposed between services
threats.mitigation: Use mutual TLS (mTLS) for service-to-service communication

threats.title: Login request manipulation
threats.description: Attackers could tamper with login requests or inject malicious data
threats.mitigation:
Input Validation: "Server-side validation of all login parameters"

    CSRF Protection: "Implement anti-CSRF tokens for all forms"

    Request Signing: "Use HMAC signatures for critical requests"

    API Security: "Rate limiting and request integrity checks"

threats.title: Credentials intercepted in transit
threats.description: Student login credentials could be captured during transmission
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS encryption

threats.title: Expedition
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #6:
Using speed to violate explicit or implicit assumptions about the application’s normal use to achieve unfair individual gain
threats.mitigation: Defences include providing enforcement of behavioral workflow and anti-automation

threats.title: Vulnerability scanning
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #14:
Systematic enumeration and examination in order to find weaknesses and points where a security vulnerability might exist
threats.mitigation: Defence includes providing anti-automation

threats.title: Denial of Service
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #15:
Usage may resemble legitimate application usage but leads to exhaustion of resources
threats.mitigation: Mitigation or prevention such as providing backoff, resource management and avoiding forced deadlock

threats.title: Unauthorized changes cannot be traced
threats.description: Administrators or attackers could modify student records and deny doing it, with no proof of who made changes
threats.mitigation: Comprehensive audit logging with user attribution, immutable audit trails, regular log reviews

threats.title: Student data breach
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sensitive student information (personal data, SSN, addresses)
threats.mitigation: Data encryption at rest, field-level encryption for PII, strict access controls"

threats.title: Student record manipulation
threats.description: Unauthorized modification of student records or personal information
threats.mitigation: Detect fake or compromised accounts, ensure information is accessible only with authentication and authorisation

threats.title: Skewing
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #16:
Automated repeated clicking or requesting or submitting content, affecting application based metrics such as counts, and measures of frequency and/or rate
threats.mitigation: Defences include control of interaction frequency or proper enforcement of a single unique action

threats.title: Spamming
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #17:
Storing malicious such as malware, Iframe distribution, photographs & videos, advertisements, referrer spam and tracking/surveillance code
threats.mitigation: Defences include detecting embedded malicious code, controling interaction frequency and enforcement of a single unique action

threats.title: Unauthorized grade modification
threats.description: Students or attackers could illegally change academic grades
threats.mitigation: Strict access controls, grade change approval workflows, cryptographic signing of grades

threats.title: Scraping
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #11:
Collecting accessible data and/or processed output from the application
threats.mitigation: Detect fake or compromised accounts, ensure information is accessible only with authentication and authorisation
